thread.section_title: WDT News Feed: Watertown Daily Times: Local Sports
thread.title: FL roundup: IHC girls soccer topples Carthage in ‘A’ Division semifinal
thread.title_full: FL roundup: IHC girls soccer topples Carthage in ‘A’ Division semifinal

title: FL roundup: IHC girls soccer topples Carthage in ‘A’ Division semifinal
text:
A A 
WATERTOWN — Megan Welch’s goal in the 70th minute helped the second-seeded Immaculate Heart Central girls soccer team edge No. 3 Carthage, 2-1, in the Frontier League “A” Division semifinals on Wednesday night. 
Kate O’Neil started the scoring in the fifth minute and Amanda McIlhern made four saves for the Cavaliers (8-5-1), who will play top seed and host Watertown in the “A” title game at noon Saturday. 
Kendra Grimm scored and Emma Hermmann stopped eight shots for the Comets (5-10). 
WATERTOWN 8, INDIAN RIVER 0 
Olivia Miles scored three goals to go with an assist, and made three saves after moving to goalie to lead the Cyclones over the No. 4 Warriors (0-12) in the “A” Division semifinals. 
Jillian Girardi provided two goals and two assists, and Emma Nevers added a goal for Watertown (11-1-3). 
SACKETS HARBOR 3, BELLEVILLE HENDERSON 0 
Jamie Lynn Mendelson scored twice in the first 10 minutes as the top-seeded Patriots blanked the No. 4 Panthers (5-10) in a “D” Division semifinal at Sackets Harbor. 
Sarah Gray scored from a corner kick for Sackets Harbor (14-1), which faces Lyme in the “D” Division title game at 2 p.m. Saturday at Watertown. 
LYME 1, LAFARGEVILLE 0 (2 OT) 
Lauren Barry scored late as No. 3 Indians upset the second-seeded Red Knights in a “D” Division semifinal at LaFargeville. 
Keerah McCratic made five saves for Lyme (6-6-1). Emma Timerman stopped 15 shots for LaFargeville (9-5-1). 
SANDY CREEK 1, A-P-W 0 
Savannah Brown tallied in the 29th minute as the Comets picked up their first win of the season with a nonleague victory over the Rebels in Sandy Creek. 
Maggie Vazquez made six saves for Sandy Creek (1-13). 
Sid Jones collected six saves for Altmar-Parish-Williamstown (3-11-1). 
GIRLS TENNIS 
IHC’S CROSS MAKES SEMIS 
Immaculate Heart Central senior Talulah Cross continued her perfect season by advancing to the Section 3 Division IV final at Utica. 
Cross beat Beaver River’s Jessie Landis 6-3, 6-3 to reach the semis and earned a spot in the state qualifying tournament. The semifinals and championships will be Friday at Liverpool. 
Landis and teammate Tabitha Tabolt won opening-round matches for the Beavers. The Beaver River doubles team of Lesley Aucter and Dana Halladay made it to the quarterfinals. 
Indian River’s Erin O’Brien and the doubles team of Kammikia Barnes and Paige Leonard made the quarterfinals before being ousted in Division II at Syracuse. In Division III at Utica, Lowville’s doubles team of Maryum Kirch and Abby Rockwood won their opening round match before losing in the next round.
